it.polimi.se2018.view

Class ClientView

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.se2018.utils.Observable<ViewMessage>
      • it.polimi.se2018.view.View
        • it.polimi.se2018.view.ClientView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observer<ModelUpdate>

    public class ClientView
extends View
    This class represents the client-side view.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      ClientView(Displayer displayer)
      Creates a ClientView instance that uses the given Displayer to represent data on screen.

      • update

        public void update(ModelUpdate message)
        Description copied from interface: Observer
        Updates the observer that an event has occurred.

        This method is called by the observables which the observer is registered to whenever they want to notify of a change in their state.

        Parameters:
        message - An object containing the data to define the event

        destination - The destination of the die on the pattern.

                                    int sacrifice)

        Parameters:

        sacrifice - The index of the die to be sacrificed to use the tool card.

        public void handleToolCardUsage(int index,
                                boolean increment)
        Handles the event in which the player wants to use a tool card.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the die from the draft pool.
        increment - true if the die value has to be incremented; false if it has to be decremented.

      • handleLogin

        public void handleLogin(java.lang.String playerName,
                        java.lang.String serverAddress,
                        java.lang.String serviceName)
        Handles the case in which the player logs in.

        This method sets the communication protocol with the server to Java RMI.

        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player.
        serverAddress - The address of the server.
        serviceName - The name of the RMI service on the server.

      • handleLogin

        public void handleLogin(java.lang.String playerName,
                        java.lang.String serverAddress,
                        int port)
        Handles the case in which the player logs in.

        This method sets the communication protocol with the server to TCP.

        Parameters:
        playerName - The name of the player.
        serverAddress - The address of the server.
        port - The port on the server where the service is listening on.
